doc:
Jean Mamy https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean_Mamy 0 Jean Mamy (8 July 1912, Chambéry, Savoie – 29 March 1949, Arcueil) was a French actor, producer, film and theatre director, screenwriter and journalist, notable for his collaboration with the Vichy regime (for which he was shot in 1949). He was also known by the pseudonym Paul Riche, and wrote for L'Appel. He belonged to the inter-war left and was film editor on Jean Renoir's 1931 On purge bébé, but on the fall of France he decided on collaboration. His last film was the anti-Masonic 1943 film Forces occultes, which he directed (he had from 1931 to 1939 been Venerable of the Renan lodge of the Grand Orient de France, but had since parted company with Freemasonry). Jean_Mamy ( 8_July_1912 , Chambéry , Savoie – 29_March_1949_,_Arcueil ) was a_French_actor , producer_,_film_and_theatre_director , screenwriter_and_journalist , notable_for his_collaboration with the_Vichy_regime ( for which he was_shot in 1949 ) . He was_also_known by the_pseudonym_Paul_Riche , and wrote for L'Appel . He belonged to the_inter-war_left and was film_editor on Jean_Renoir 's_1931 On purge_bébé , but on the_fall of France he decided on collaboration . His_last_film was the_anti-Masonic_1943_film_Forces_occultes , which he directed ( he had from 1931 to 1939_been_Venerable of the_Renan lodge of the_Grand_Orient de France , but had since parted_company with Freemasonry_) .
